alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 5:16PM CDT until May 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason and Menard. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mason, Streeter, Grit, Hedwigs Hill, Hilda, Long Mountain, Art, Saline, Camp Air, London, Katemcy, Yates Crossing, Loyal Valley, Fredonia, Pontotoc, Koockville, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, Erna, Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 469 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, crossings along FM 1221, Oak Grove crossing, Spy Rock crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Vater crossing Hasse Creek and Katemcy crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
